intro: Murdannia clandestina, commonly known as the hidden murdannia, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and inconspicuous white flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a short lifespan and is often found in disturbed or wetland habitats. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
